PV1.competency: Creates a vision for the product with the team, stakeholders, and end users. If the product requires a Product Manager, this is a responsibility of the Product Manager but a Product Owner should be familiar with the vision and the process to create it

examples.0: Limited experience or knowledge. May have some familiarity but no hands-on or professional experience.
examples.1: Has some experience or knowledge. Can perform with limited oversight and guidance.
examples.2: Has production-level experience and deep hands-on knowledge. Can effectively share knowledge and assist others.
examples.3: Expert-level. Fully autonomous and can deliver consistently with an exceptional degree of quality.

PV2.competency: Defines the minimum viable product (MVP) as epics and features for the product and breaks this down across multiple releases into a product roadmap that spans at least 12 months. If the product requires a Product Manager, this is a responsibility of the Product Manager but a Product Owner should be familiar with what is MVP and the process to develop it

examples.0: Limited experience or knowledge. May have some familiarity but no hands-on or professional experience.
examples.1: Has some experience or knowledge. Can perform with limited oversight and guidance.
examples.2: Has production-level experience and deep hands-on knowledge. Can effectively share knowledge and assist others.
examples.3: Expert-level. Fully autonomous and can deliver consistently with an exceptional degree of quality.

PV3.competency: Creates acceptance criteria for all features on the product roadmap and is able to explain the why behind each feature. If the product requires a Product Manager, this is a responsibility of the Product Manager but a Product Owner should be familiar with feature acceptance criteria and the process to develop it

examples.0: Limited experience or knowledge. May have some familiarity but no hands-on or professional experience.
examples.1: Has some experience or knowledge. Can perform with limited oversight and guidance.
examples.2: Has production-level experience and deep hands-on knowledge. Can effectively share knowledge and assist others.
examples.3: Expert-level. Fully autonomous and can deliver consistently with an exceptional degree of quality.

PV4.competency: Represents the Voice of the Client by adapting the product roadmap to changing external conditions and user feedback. If the product requires a Product Manager, this is a responsibility of the Product Manager but a Product Owner should be familiar with changes to the roadmap and the process to adapt it

examples.0: Limited experience or knowledge. May have some familiarity but no hands-on or professional experience.
examples.1: Has some experience or knowledge. Can perform with limited oversight and guidance.
examples.2: Has production-level experience and deep hands-on knowledge. Can effectively share knowledge and assist others.
examples.3: Expert-level. Fully autonomous and can deliver consistently with an exceptional degree of quality.

PV5.competency: Facilitates team, stakeholder, and business owner buy into the product roadmap. If the product requires a Product Manager, this is a responsibility of the Product Manager but a Product Owner should be familiar with how to facilitate buy-in into the product roadmap
